newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine industrial output remains strong - FIEL.
newsitem.headline: Argentine industrial output remains strong - FIEL.

text.p: Argentine industrial production in January rose less than the average in recent months but the recovery in output remains strong, private consultants FIEL said Monday.

"Preliminary figures for January indicate a rise of 0.5 percent (from the previous month), less than the average in previous months," a FIEL source told Reuters. "But there is no doubt that the recovery is strong."
On Feb 24, FIEL is scheduled to release its December index and the preliminary data for January of industrial production.
In previous months, industrial production rose an average of 1.5 percent.
The source said compared to January 1996, industrial production rose 13 percent.

FIEL warns that the figures for January can be distorted by the summer holidays, and that levels of industrial production in the first quarter are better measured by waiting for February and March data.

"One cannot make profound conclusions with only the January figure - one has to wait to see what happens during the summer to have a more exact idea of what is happening in the speed of the recovery in industrial production," said the source.
